patterns.title: Requirement-Analyst First for Complex Projects
patterns.context: User requests with ambiguous scope or unclear requirements
patterns.strategy: ALWAYS dispatch requirement-analyst before implementation specialists
patterns.evidence: Prevents scope drift, clarifies acceptance criteria, reduces rework (template)

patterns.title: Verification-Agent Before Quality-Validator
patterns.strategy: Dispatch verification-agent to verify claims, then quality-validator for final gate
patterns.evidence: Verification finds false completions, quality-validator ensures production readiness. SEO Phase 1-4: Zero false completions through bash verification (ls, grep, wc)

patterns.title: Parallel Dispatch for Independent Tasks
patterns.context: Multiple tasks with no dependencies (UI + API, iOS + Android)
patterns.strategy: Dispatch specialists in parallel using single message with multiple Task calls
patterns.evidence: 40-50% faster than serial dispatch, reduces total orchestration time (template)

patterns.title: Design-Reviewer MANDATORY for Production UIs
patterns.strategy: ALWAYS include design-reviewer in team composition for production releases
patterns.evidence: Catches visual bugs, spacing issues, accessibility violations before users see them (template)

patterns.title: System-Architect for Multi-System Projects
patterns.strategy: Dispatch system-architect to design complete architecture before implementation
patterns.evidence: Prevents integration issues, ensures consistent API contracts, identifies bottlenecks early (template)

patterns.title: Work Orders Reduce Context Hunting
patterns.context: Large projects with complex architectural context
patterns.strategy: Create .orchestration/work-orders/[task-id].md with full context before dispatching specialists
patterns.evidence: Specialists waste 30-40% less tokens searching for context (template)

patterns.title: Signal Logging for Debugging
patterns.strategy: Log SESSION_START, PLAYBOOK_LOADED, SPECIALIST_DISPATCHED events to signal-log.jsonl
patterns.evidence: Complete audit trail enables debugging failed sessions, pattern analysis (template)

patterns.title: Cost Tracking Identifies Expensive Specialists
patterns.strategy: Track tokens and cost per specialist in costs.json
patterns.evidence: Identifies inefficient specialists consuming excess tokens, enables optimization (template)

patterns.title: Test-Engineer for Critical Functionality
patterns.context: Projects with authentication, payments, data integrity requirements
patterns.strategy: Include test-engineer to create comprehensive test suites for critical paths
patterns.evidence: Prevents production bugs in high-risk areas, ensures regression coverage (template)

patterns.title: SELF_AUDIT_PROTOCOL Before Claiming Complete
patterns.context: All major implementations (3+ agents, deprecations, system changes)
patterns.strategy: Run SELF_AUDIT_PROTOCOL.md 7-phase audit before marking work complete
patterns.evidence: Catches systemic failures, prevents doc drift, ensures integration correctness (template)

patterns.title: Plan-Synthesis for Interface Validation
patterns.context: Multi-specialist tasks with interface dependencies (frontend + backend)
patterns.strategy: Use plan-synthesis-agent to validate API contracts before implementation
patterns.evidence: Resolves PLAN_UNCERTAINTY tags, prevents integration failures (template)

patterns.title: Multi-Phase Implementation Workflow
patterns.context: Complex improvements requiring multiple coordinated changes
patterns.strategy: Break complex improvements into 5 phases: (1) Data Infrastructure, (2) Content Extraction/Processing, (3) Principles/Heuristics, (4) Enforcement/Validation, (5) Integration/Documentation. Implement sequentially with clear completion criteria per phase. Verify before moving to next phase. Document after implementation complete.
patterns.evidence: SEO Phase 1-4: 2-3hr investment for 5-phase system avoided 4+ hrs per article. Complete execution without stopping prevents context loss and rework. Documentation after implementation eliminates drift.

patterns.title: Evidence-Based Completion Protocol
patterns.strategy: Before claiming ANY work is complete: (1) File operations - verify with ls -lh, git diff, grep. (2) Integration points - verify with grep for imports/calls. (3) Data structures - verify with cat/jq. (4) Output quality - verify with wc/grep. (5) Documentation consistency - verify with grep counts. Never claim done without command output proving the claim.
patterns.evidence: SEO Phase 1-4: Zero false completions through systematic bash verification. Command output is objective evidence preventing false confidence.

patterns.title: Build Right First Philosophy
patterns.context: Starting any new implementation or system improvement
patterns.strategy: Invest upfront in proper planning and architecture. Prefer complete systems over MVPs that need rebuilding. Run quality gates even when expensive. Total cost of building right first < total cost of iteration loops.
patterns.evidence: SEO Phase 1-4: 2-3hr upfront investment avoided 4+ hrs per article. First article pays back implementation cost; every subsequent article is pure gain. Quality gates prevent publication of low-clarity content requiring rework.

patterns.title: Complete Execution Without Stopping
patterns.strategy: When user requests complete execution ('crank through all of this'), implement all phases without interruption. Context switching is expensive. Complete system is testable; partial system requires assumptions.
patterns.evidence: SEO Phase 1-4: All 5 phases implemented in single session without stopping mid-flow. User instruction 'continue, no stopping, we don't want that confusion' honored. Complete system delivered ready for use.

patterns.title: Skipping Verification Leads to False Completions
patterns.strategy: AVOID claiming work complete without verification-agent checking with grep/ls/bash
patterns.evidence: 80% of false completions come from skipping verification step (template)

patterns.title: Serial Dispatch Wastes Time
patterns.context: Independent tasks (separate UI components, parallel platform development)
patterns.strategy: AVOID dispatching specialists one-by-one when tasks have no dependencies
patterns.evidence: Serial dispatch takes 2x longer than parallel for independent work (template)

patterns.title: Omitting Requirement-Analyst Causes Scope Drift
patterns.strategy: AVOID jumping straight to implementation without clarifying requirements
patterns.evidence: 60% of rework stems from unclear requirements captured upfront (template)

patterns.title: Skipping Design Review for Internal Tools
patterns.strategy: AVOID omitting design-reviewer for 'internal only' UIs
patterns.evidence: Internal tools used daily, poor UX compounds productivity loss (template)

patterns.title: Specialist vs Monolithic Trade-off
patterns.strategy: For trivial tasks (<30 lines, 1 file), direct implementation may be faster than orchestration overhead
patterns.evidence: Orchestration adds 2-3 minutes setup; beneficial when task complexity justifies it (template)
